session.title: Simulation for Professional Services Agreement
session.jurisdiction_note: Contract governed by California law, with specific provisions for termination, indemnification, and compliance with state and federal regulations.

timeline.title: Agreement Effective Date
timeline.description: Contract takes effect upon COMMISSION governing board approval
timeline.detailed_description: The Agreement becomes effective on the specified date, contingent upon prior approval by the COMMISSION governing board. CONSULTANT commences work after notification to proceed by the COMMISSION’s Contract Manager.
risks: Work cannot start without board approval
Delays in approval may impact project timeline

timeline.title: Monthly Invoice Submission
timeline.description: CONSULTANT submits itemized invoices within 45 days of work performance
timeline.detailed_description: Invoices must include labor details, itemized expenses, total payment requested, cumulative payments, expenditure report by task, and written progress reports. Final invoice must be submitted within 60 days after acceptance of work.

timeline.title: Progress Payment Due
timeline.description: COMMISSION makes progress payments no less than monthly in arrears
timeline.detailed_description: Payments are based on satisfactory services provided and actual allowable incurred costs. Payment may be delayed if deliverables are not submitted according to schedule.
risks: Payment delay if deliverables are late

timeline.title: Compliance and Audit Review
timeline.description: Monthly review of contract adherence and potential audits
timeline.detailed_description: COMMISSION reviews progress reports and may conduct audits. CONSULTANT must maintain records for 5 years from final payment or until audit completion.
risks: Non-compliance with record retention may incur penalties

timeline.title: Agreement End Date
timeline.description: Contract ends on specified date unless terminated or extended
timeline.detailed_description: The Agreement terminates on the end date unless earlier terminated for convenience or default, or extended by amendment.
risks: Default termination may lead to reprocurement costs

exit_comparisons.label: Termination for Convenience (COMMISSION)
exit_comparisons.penalty_text: Allowable costs incurred + reasonable termination costs

exit_comparisons.label: Termination for Default (COMMISSION)
exit_comparisons.penalty_text: Reprocurement costs + all reasonable costs incurred
exit_comparisons.benefits_lost: Liability for all COMMISSION costs, potential legal action

exit_comparisons.label: Termination by CONSULTANT
exit_comparisons.penalty_text: Reprocurement costs + all reasonable costs incurred
exit_comparisons.benefits_lost: Liability for COMMISSION costs, forfeiture of unpaid amounts

narratives.title: Smooth Contract Execution
narratives.subtitle: Ideal compliance with all terms
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT submits all invoices on time, provides required progress reports, and meets all deliverables. COMMISSION makes timely payments, and the contract concludes without disputes or penalties.
key_points: All insurance and compliance requirements met

narratives.title: Payment Delay and Audit Dispute
narratives.subtitle: Late invoice submission leads to payment delay and audit findings
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT delays invoice submission, causing payment delays. An audit reveals non-compliance with record retention, leading to disputes and additional costs for reprocurement and penalties.
financial_impact: Late payment fees: ₹500 per delayed invoice

narratives.title: Termination for Default
narratives.subtitle: CONSULTANT breaches agreement terms, leading to termination
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT fails to cure a breach within 10 days after written notice, such as non-compliance with insurance requirements or discrimination policies. COMMISSION terminates for default, invoking reprocurement costs and penalties.
key_points: Breach of insurance or compliance terms

long_term.label: Year 1
long_term.description: Base contract amount with no penalties

long_term.label: Year 2
long_term.description: Cumulative base amount for two-year term

long_term.label: Year 3
long_term.description: Cumulative base amount for three-year term

long_term.label: Year 5
long_term.description: Cumulative base amount for five-year term with potential extensions

risk_alerts.message: Insurance Compliance: CONSULTANT must maintain required insurance coverage throughout the term. Failure to do so allows COMMISSION to terminate immediately, resulting in significant reprocurement costs and penalties.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Ensure all insurance policies are current and certificates are submitted on time. Monitor expiration dates and renew policies 30 days prior to expiry.

risk_alerts.message: Invoice Submission Deadline: Invoices must be submitted within 45 days of work performance. Late submission delays payment and may incur penalties or lead to termination.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Implement a system to track work performance dates and submit invoices promptly. Include all required details to avoid rejection.

risk_alerts.message: Record Retention: CONSULTANT must maintain all records for 5 years post-payment. Failure to do so may result in audit penalties and legal disputes.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Establish a secure record-keeping system. Ensure all subcontractors also comply with retention policies.

risk_alerts.message: Termination for Default: COMMISSION can terminate for breach with only 10 days to cure. This includes breaches of insurance, compliance, or discrimination policies, leading to high reprocurement costs.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Regularly review contract terms for compliance. Address any issues immediately upon notice to avoid default termination.

risk_alerts.message: Subcontracting Restrictions: No subcontracting without prior written authorization. Unauthorized subcontracting may lead to termination and liability for costs.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Seek written approval for any subcontracting. Ensure subcontracts include all required provisions from the main agreement.
